verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
On a hill far away
Stood an old rugged cross
The emblem of suffering and shame
And I love that old cross
Where the dearest and best
For a world of lost sinners was slain.
Chorus:
So I'll cherish the old rugged cross
Till my trophies at last I lay down
I will cling to the old rugged cross
And exchange it someday for a crown.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
O, the old rugged cross, so despised by the world
Has a wondrous attraction for me
For the dear Lamb of God left His glory above
To bear it to dark Calvary.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
To the old rugged cross I will ever be true
Its shame and reproach gladly bear
Then He'll call me someday to my home in this way
Where His glory forever I'll share.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
O thou old rugged cross come and live in my heart
And lead me to death every day.
That the life of my Lord may flow out of my heart
To His body and all men I pray.
